Instrument.name: Lyman Alpha Mapping Project
Instrument.description: The Lyman-Alpha Mapper (LAMP) is an imaging ultraviolet (UV) spectrometer designed to use low UV light conditions due to starlight and Lyman sky-glow to image the permanently shadowed regions near the Moon's poles. The instrument objectives are to identify and localize exposed water frost and collect landform-scale mapping in permanently shadowed regions, demonstrate the feasibility of starlight and sky-glow illumination for future missions, and assay the lunar atmosphere and its variability.
